Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

AIL_set_stream_volume_levels

The function AIL_set_stream_volume_levels controls a stream's playback volume levels.

void AIL_set_stream_volume_levels(
  HSTREAM S,
  F32 left_level,
  F32 right_level
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the stream whose volume is to be set.
left_level
is the left speaker volume level from 0 (minimum) to 1.0 (maximum).
right_level
is the right speaker volume level from 0 (minimum) to 1.0 (maximum).

Discussion

This volume setting is linear in amplitude - using 0.5 is equivalent to 6 dB down. Use AIL_set_stream_volume_pan to set volume linear in loudness.

All sample volume scaling occurs at full sample precision.

If this is a mono sample, only the left level has any effect.

Example files that use this function: SSTEST.C
